PulseProgram¶

exception DependencyError(name)[source]¶
class PulseProgram[source]¶

Encapsulates a PulseProgrammer Program loadSource( filename ) loads the contents of the file The code is compiled in the following steps

parse() generates self.code toBytecode() generates self.bytecode toBinary() generates self.binarycode

the procedure updateVariables( dictionary ) updates variable values in the bytecode

addDefine(m, lineno, sourcename)[source]¶

add the define to the self.defines dictionary

addLabel(label, address, sourcename, lineno)[source]¶
addVariable(m, lineno, sourcename)[source]¶

add a variable to the self.variablesdict

appendVariableCode()[source]¶

append all variables to the instruction part of the code

codelinePattern = re.compile('(\\s*[^#\\s]+)', re.IGNORECASE)¶
compileCode()[source]¶
convertParameter(mag, encoding=None)[source]¶

convert a dimensioned parameter to the binary value expected by the hardware. The conversion is determined by the variable encoding

definePattern = re.compile('const\\s+(\\w+)\\s+(\\w+)[^#\n\r]*')¶

flattenList(l)[source]¶

insertSource(pp_file)[source]¶

read a source file pp_file calls itself recursively to for #insert adds the contents of this file to the dictionary self.source

labelPattern = re.compile('(\\w+):\\s+([^#\n\r]*)')¶
lineOfInstruction(line)[source]¶
loadFromMemory(docompile=True)[source]¶

Similar to loadSource only this routine loads from self.source

loadSource(pp_file, docompile=True)[source]¶

Load the source pp_file #include files are loaded recursively all code lines are added to self.sourcelines for each source file the contents are added to the dictionary self.source

multiVariableUpdateCode(variablenames, values)[source]¶
opPattern = re.compile('\\s*(\\w+)(?:\\s+([^#\n\r]*)){0,1}', re.IGNORECASE)¶

VariableDictionary¶

exception CyclicDependencyException[source]¶
class VariableDictionary(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Ordered Dictionary to hold variable values. It maintains a dependency graph to check for cycles and to recalculate the necessary values when one of the fields is updated

addDependencies(graph, dependencies, name)[source]¶

add all the dependencies to name

addEdgeNoCycle(graph, first, second)[source]¶

add the dependency to the graph, raise CyclicDependencyException in case of cyclic dependencies

bareDictionaryCopy()[source]¶
calculateDependencies()[source]¶
expression = <modules.Expression.Expression object at 0x000002665C7E2630>¶
merge(variabledict, globaldict=None, overwrite=False, linkNewToParent=False)[source]¶
recalculateAll()[source]¶
recalculateDependent(node, returnResult=False)[source]¶
recalculateNode(node)[source]¶
setEnabledIndex(index, enabled)[source]¶
setEncodingIndex(index, encoding)[source]¶
setGlobaldict(globaldict)[source]¶
setParentStrValue(name, strvalue)[source]¶
setParentValue(name, value)[source]¶

update the variable value with value and recalculate as necessary. This is done using existing dependencies.

setStrValue(name, strvalue)[source]¶

update the variable value with strvalue and recalculate as necessary

setStrValueIndex(index, strvalue)[source]¶
setValue(name, value)[source]¶

update the variable value with value and recalculate as necessary. This is done using existing dependencies.

class VariableDictionaryView(variableDictionary)[source]¶

View on VariableDictionary that combines the local dictionary with the global dictionary the returnvalue is the evaluated value for both dictionaries

__getitem__(key)[source]¶

if the key is in the local dictionary return the value, if it is in the global dictionary return that value, otherwise raise KeyError
